channel.title: The Ark
channel.description: The Ark is the weekly newspaper of Tiburon, Belvedere and Strawberry

item.title: Belvedere OKs housing plan, zoning overhaul for state approval
item.description: The votes effectively end nearly four years of work to bring the city into compliance with state housing requirements.
item.dc:creator: Tyler Callister

item.title: Belvedere shifting coyote reporting to Marin Humane
item.description: Since 2023, at least five dogs and four cats have been killed by coyotes, and seven other pets have been injured, according to reports received by the city.
item.dc:creator: Tyler Callister

item.title: Tiburon Peninsula rolling out holiday fairs, performances and charity drives
item.description: The Tiburon Peninsula Chamber of Commerce’s annual holiday festival anchors the events, scheduled for 2-5 p.m. Dec. 6.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Belvedere homeowners face $2,928 fee to exit historic designation
item.description: Belvedere residents who missed out on the Mills Act tax-incentive program can get $366 streamlined removal.
item.dc:creator: Tyler Callister

item.title: Reality TV pilot spotlights Cinelounge Tiburon owners’ fight to save movie theaters
item.description: Mill Valley’s Alexandra Duparc filmed Christian and Camilla Meoli for the “Saving Cinema” pilot in October.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Everyday Encounters: A Belvedere student with passion for robotics ponders the future of AI
item.description: Maddie, 17 and a junior at Redwood, says she dreams of becoming a mechanical engineer someday.
item.dc:creator: Tyler Callister

item.title: Belvedere-Tiburon Library exhibit pairs Bay Area creators with muses from art history
item.description: Rachel Davis, Nadine Levin and Joyce Bell are among 58 Bay Area artists featured in “Pairings & Echoes,” which runs Nov. 20 through Jan. 7.
item.dc:creator: Diane Smith

item.title: Builder reveals design of $12 mil hybrid vessel for Angel Island-Tiburon Ferry Co.
item.description: EV Maritime is designing the 64-foot plug-in-hybrid vessel tentatively named Watts Up.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Lorrie Lee Levin Greene
item.description: Lorrie Lee Levin Greene, a lifelong Bay Area native, passed away surrounded by family peacefully at home on November 7, 2025, at the age of 83.
item.dc:creator: Reader submitted

item.title: William Blackmer Canada
item.description: William Blackmer Canada, born on November 8, 1939, at St. John’s Hospital in Tulsa, OK, passed away on November 3rd.
item.dc:creator: Reader submitted

item.title: Tiburon officer charged with DUI, child cruelty, pleads not guilty
item.description: Tiburon police officer William Forrest Condit has pleaded not guilty to one count of misdemeanor child cruelty and two counts of misdemeanor drunken driving.
item.dc:creator: Tyler Callister
